alert.note: Alert for Cadiz Basin (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 06 at 11:50PM PST until January 07 at 10:00PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST /11 PM MST/ SUNDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 possible. This would mark the first freeze of the winter season. * WHERE...In Arizona, Lake Mead National Recreation Area. In California, Cadiz Basin. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 10 PM PST /11 PM MST/ Sunday. For the Freeze Watch, from Monday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution. Secure outdoor objects. Strong winds and rough waves on area lakes will create hazardous conditions for small craft.
